title: Iconic site
text: You cannot visit Athens and not climb up to the Parthenon. It is not a difficult climb. You just need to be careful where you step in case it might be slippy. The you stand in awe at what was done so long ago. But think of the cost in human life. It must have been massive. It was all for the Gods. I see a lot of reviews advising where and when to climb it. We were there in early April, around mid-day and it was not overcrowded. Allow yourself some time in the area.

title: You have gotta go. Its a tourist thing.
text: This area has all the usual kind thinhs you find in Tourist Trap places but this is better than most because of the gracious Greek people. They don't rip you off. The food is good and reasonably priced. The goods on sale are good value. Leather belts, table clothes and jewelry are worth a look.

title: Bucket list must do
text: I thought it looked better from the Ancient Agora than when you are actually up there but I was glad I went up. Fantastic view of Athens and surrounding area. Great history. Like so much of today, Vanity, Greed, War, Destroy and start all over again. Lessons for mankind. But it stand so proudly over the city!! We are in our latter 70s and approached the climb with some worry after seeing all the advice about slipping and how difficult it might be. It is not a very difficult climb but you have to mind your step. Much wear has left areas slippery and particularly if it rains. It was dry for us but still slippery.

title: Great but a little boring.
text: You see so much of same, one after the other. However it is all very pleasant. Well laid out. New building and great piece of modern architecture. The best thing for me was the old ruins / excavations which are left as they were discovered, more or less. You can look down on them from the glass covering them which is walk proof.

title: Stronly recommend that you start you Athens tour here
text: To get a full understanding of Athens ancient history and culture you should spend 3 hours here. It is so impressive. Artifacts going back 1300 BC. There is a great history of Athens and Greek history here going back thousands of years. Makes you realise our little lives are so small and we, like those "greats" gone before us, will also just pass on.

title: Best in the neighbourhood for food and value
text:
It seems to be mezze and do not order all the course together. That was the only mistake but it was ours.
Order one or two. Have a nice wine. Take it slowly. If order is hot/warm maybe order it on its own. They do not rush you. Its a nice building, an old school house converted. It has a big garden for outdoor eating but it was cold when we were there. Inside has a good feel to it. The food is great. I was not as pleased with the wine and there was little guidance. It was all bottled. But a great place for a good night out with friends to enjoy.

title: Great value food for student types
text: Very hospitable staff and management. Very busy. A wide selection of Greek food and big servings. Wine very good. But this is not for people expecting "upscale" dining. Is is great of its type and exceptional value. Great deserts.

title: Relaxing ambience with good value
text:
You can take as long as you like over your meal. No rush. Very clean. Food is good and healthy. Perks you up. We were just chance visitors but the locals seem to be happy there.
Great pastires and cakes. Loved their salads.

title: Excellent restaurant.
text:
Very good food. Great service. Nice part of the city. Its got the buzz.
They have variations on the usual american dishes and were most enjoyable for that.

title: Good food close to Lincoln Centre.
text: We had not booked and so had to share a high table to with other couples. Very nice and interesting people. The seats are a little too high for some people to mount them elegantly. The food was interesting and good. I enjoyed the pike which was cooked and presented in a way I never had it before, Worth trying. Overall its good food but expensive. Service was nicely paced but allow time if you are going to a show.

title: Nice Italian food at a very good price.
text: Was there for a late lunch. Friendly service and good menu. Wine was very good. You can take your time and relax. They don't rush you. We took seats inside the window and people watched. Its a very busy street most times. You can also sit outside.

title: Good asian food at great prices
text: The Newtownsmith restaurant is located in the centre of the city, close to the Town Hall Theatre and Galway Cathedral. It has lovely views along the river corrib and the canal. The service is cheerful. The food portions are generous and nice with mains for €10. Good flavour and good helpings, ideal for the hungry tourist or local. Good coffee and deserts.

title: Nice and quiet
text: Its a small wood. You can take your time over it. Romantic for couples. Fun for young kids but some people let their dogs run free which is not fair to kids. Its dark and cool in there in summer when the leaves are on the trees.

title: Convenient and pleasant
text: The Gaslight is in the Meyrick Hotel, Eyre Square, Galway, ring in the centre of the city. Its close to the tourist office, the train station and buses and coaches. It has a spacious feeling. The food is good and the service is pleasant. Its not gourmet but its good value for money and you are not rushed. Take as long as you like. Its a nice place to relax and take stock during your stay in a lovely city.

title: Great value golf.
text: Stayed with golfing friends. Good course. Fair but challenging to the ordinary golfer. Hotel currently closed for refurbishment. We stayed in the adjoining on-site houses. Spacious for two. Very good. The bar and the bar food is acceptable. The staff are fantastic. Make you feel you are on your holidays.
place: Dundrum House Hotel, Golf and Leisure Resort

title: Expensive for what you get.
text: It is very well located, within 5 mins walk to city centre. The Bedroom is clean and quiet. The breakfast is very good and prepares you for the day. I found the staff very good and helpful. The hotel lacks any wow factor. A good tourist stop if the price was better.

title: Relaxing Hotel offering value for money.
text: This is a popular place for families. Plenty of facilities. We are in the bar and the food was great in quality and value. Pleasant walks around the hotel on the shore of a lake. Should be good for fishermen. Relaxing. Good bedrooms. Pleasant staff. It is in the countryside but Mullingar is only a short car ride and Dublin is less than an hour away.
place: Bloomfield House Hotel, Leisure Club & Spa

title: Good value for Money.
text: The steak was very good. I think they probably do steak well. The fish and chips were good. Generous serving of veg. Not gourmet food. Good for a pint and good home cooked type of food. Nice staff. Friendly.

title: Great value and service
text: We have just returned from a 4 night deal for over 55s. We were made feel very welcome. Great friendly staff. The special menu for the deal was generous; 6 menu items under each course. Good spacious room. Very good beds and clean. Leisure centre is good but very busy at certain times. Plan you visit before lunchtime

title: Luxury at a reasonable price
text: Great location for City centre and South County Dublin. Beautiful grounds to enjoy. Friendly attentive staff. The food is good. The bar dining overlooks the gardens and it is more dining room than bar. Coming in from your day out is so relaxing. Not many hotels with gardens like this in Dublin.
place: Radisson Blu St. Helen's Hotel, Dublin

title: Unexpected delight
text: This Restaurant is on the main drag in Ranelagh villlage, Dublin and is within 100 yars of the LUAS station. Expected a wine bar with reasonable food but got good food and very good wines all served with a friendly attitude. Great casual dining with good atmosphere. Locals seem to like it. This food is better than many restaurants.

title: 5 star but only 1 toilet,
text: Great sushi food and small good wine list. All at reasonable prices. This is a small restaurant with seating for 40 approx. But you are not crowded. Service is delightful and you will not be rushed. The food is as good as the best Dublin has to offer in sushi. The one pity is is has only one toilet cubicle for all customers regardless of gender. Otherwise I would give it 5 stars.

title: Big Day Out
text: You need to give the time. Be there early and enjoy the talks by the zoo keepers and get to see more. I haven't been here since 1978 and it is so different. DSpend the whole day and there are lots of refuelling stops. Plenty of toilets. No more of the caged animals. They all looked relaxed and well cared for. The wooded trails add to one sense of being in the wild. Children are well catered for.

title: Good sleep in nice hotel at reasonable price
text: The bedrooms is away from the bar and ballroom and this leaves them quiet. So you can have good sleep. The Breakfast room/dining room upstairs provides a lovely view over the mountains, which were snow-covered this morning. The staff members are friendly and it is obvious they wish to make your stay enjoyable. It does not have a leisure centre which can be an advantage for some.

title: One great beach.
text: This a great beach for walking, swimming or just watching the waves. Great sand and a mile of it with sand dunes at the back. Safe fro children in most areas

title: Worth seeking out this Hidden gem.
text:
Booked in to this Hotel for a few nights to attend a family wedding. Had family get together meal in the restaurant and it was very good in spite of there being a wedding meal for over 100 people being served in the Ballroom. Breakfast is self service. What you get is excellent but the choice of cooked items isn't as wide as other hotels. Our party was very happy with it.
The rooms are a good size with good beds and very clean. The staff are very friendly and obliging. It seems to be very popular for weddings and this might lead to some noise on such nights. Therefore ask in advance re weddings and seek an quiet room away for the Ballroom noise. They have plenty of quiet rooms. It is worth going out of your way to try this hotel if you are touring the midlands or going west. It has a leisure centre with swimming pool which I did not use.

title: Relaxing wind down
text: Lovely location on the shores of the lake and next door to Athlone Golf Club. Good food at a reasonable rate. Good rooms and leisure facilities. Don't steal the salt cellars and the owner will reward you. Thanks.

title: Great food and service.
text: It has a nice atmosphere. We were made feel welcome. The food is great and good value. It is not pretentious. They don't tell you where every ingredient comes from, like some places. Three had fish dishes and one steak. All were perfect and the servings were judged to perfection in that you had enough to satisfy you and you could still feel like dancing. Close to city centre.

title: Could be much better
text: This hotel is very reasonably priced. However it has a lonely atmosphere. The lights are on sensors in the corridors and other places which means you walk into a darkened area. The lights are quick to react but it creates the wrong atmosphere. Bar food dinner is poor. There is a very good pool, steam room and sauna but were unattended on my visit. I fould it difficult to find on a dark wet night. My Garmin didn't show it. But google maps has it. It might improve. I think it has been recently taken over from Radisson. The friendly helpful Staff make up for the shortcomings.

title: Peace and quiet to linger over art.
text: Small but Good Collection by mainly Irish artists. Enjoy paintings by Sean Keating, Jack Yeats, Paul Henry, Chas Lamb. Take you time as study them. Very rewarding. Some sculpture on the ground floor. Good collection of watercolours. Periodical exhibitions such as Harry Clarke and Great Southern Hotels collection "Home and Away" . the latter is on currently and is very good. And its ALL FREE

title: Friendly and good portions
text: Many the the Michelin star restaurants are big on the look of it the dish and talk it up. This was very good food. No nonsense. Generous portions. Nice ambience. Pleasant staff.

title: Great Location, Clean, Good value
text: I note other reviews comment on the small rooms. They are small but very well equipped and laid out. Take a Club Room if you think you need some space. It is still tight but perfect. Our double Club Rook had very good en-suite facilities. Great shower. No problems with water. Although overlooking the street, It was reasonably quiet but use ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Very good beds. Great Friendly staff. Fantastic location with 2 tube stations within 200 yards giving you lots of travel options. So convenient. One of the best kept, cleanest hotels I have stayed in London. Some of the bigger hotels could copy!! Breakfast is excellent and sets you up for a days touring. I was surprised and delighted with this hotel

title: Improved Pit stop Galway to Dublin route
text:
Called here recently to take break on my Dublin to Galway (M6) trip for toilet and coffee break,
Toilets clean, Good carvery lunch being served at reasonable price. I had fresh sandwich of the roast of the day with salad and coffee. My friend had scone with coffee. All for €10.70. Excellent value for money. Friendly staff and fast service, This place has improved. Give them it a try.

title: Interesting unhurried golf with great views
text: This is a good testing golf course. You might loose some balls. Take it easy. It was not very busy the Wednesday I played there last June. Check out for cheaper Green Fee deals with the owners; they can be kind. Great views of Galway Bay, The Aran Islands. A delight. Not much life at the 19th hole. Big clubhouse with little to offer.

title: Great sushi
text: Well located on Pearl Street. Visited in mid afternoon and it was reasonably uncrowded. A great respite from heat and shopping. Good choice of beers and an extensive menu sushi menu at reasonable price. Mike looked after us with some charm explained the menu items to us Great place to linger over the sushi and another beer while people watching. Good clean toilets.

title: Boulder Buzz
text: Pearl Street is worth a visit for the tourist but it only needs 4 hours. It is so like other tourist fly traps. But it has a buzz in the evening time. Well worth eating or drinking there. Good restaurants and bars on the street and within 2 blocks either way for the same atmosphere. Friendly laid back.

title: Good value clean hotel
text: Nice clean hotel with comfortable beds. Staff are vert helpful and friendly. If you are a light sleeper seek room not facing the motorway. It has business centre and bistro for snack eats with limited range.

title: Good hotel. Great location
text: Located I. Kensington near museums and V&A. Close to tube to Heathrow. Theatre land easily accessed. Safe and secure hotel. Professional frienliness and courteous staff. Good free internet in room every day ( 6). Liked the sweets candy in foyer in late afternoon. Plenty of eating options within yards.
